clinical_study.brief_title: Predisposing Factors Associated With Chemotherapy Toxicity in Elderly Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Predisposing Factors Associated With Chemotherapy Toxicity in Elderly Cancer Patients: A Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: These days, there is higher proportion of elderly cancer patients. Most of them have comorbidities, borderline performance status and nutritional status. The discontinuation of chemotherapy due to unbearable toxicities was not uncommon. Comprehensive geriatric assessment might be beneficial in selection of suitable elderly patients for chemotherapy administration.

detailed_description.textblock: The patients with the age more than 70 years old who scheduled for chemotherapy were enrolled. Geriatric assessment was performed before starting chemotherapy. The toxicity will be recorded prospectively. Predisposing factors of grade 3 and 4 toxicity will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: predisposing factors of patients developed grade 3 or 4 chemotherapy toxicity
primary_outcome.time_frame: from starting chemotherapy to 1 month after last dose of chemotherapy

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of grade 3 or 4 chemotherapy toxicity in elderly
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from starting chemotherapy to 1 month after last dose of chemotherapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Factors associated with good quality of life during receiving chemotherapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from starting chemotherapy to 1 month after last dose of chemotherapy

arm_group.description: Patients who are older than 70 years old receiving chemotherapy

study_pop.textblock: cancer patients who are older than 70 years old and receiving chemotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- more than 70 years of age
- plan to receive first cycle of chemotherapy
- histologically or cytologically proved of cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients who have concurrent chemoradiotherapy
- patients who received local chemotherapy
